channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Trump opposes efforts to rename military bases
Coronavirus has stolen our most meaningful ways to connect
China flexes military muscle amid coronavirus pandemic
item.description: As the world is distracted by the Covid-19 pandemic, China appears to be making bold military moves on multiple fronts, causing experts to warn of the tension between the US and China. CNN's David Culver reports.

item.title: George Floyd's brother tells US Congress: 'He didn't deserve to die over $20'
item.description: George Floyd's brother, Philonise Floyd, will tell House lawmakers that his brother "didn't deserve to die over $20," asking them "is that what a black man's life is worth? Twenty dollars? This is 2020. Enough is enough."

item.title: Fresh call to remove Confederate statues from US Capitol
All Lives Matter protesters re-enacted George Floyd's death as a Black Lives Matter march went by
item.description: A New Jersey corrections officer was suspended and a FedEx worker fired after two All Lives Matter demonstrators mockingly re-enacted George Floyd's death on Monday to apparently counter a Black Lives Matter march in Franklinville, New Jersey.

item.title: Friend of man shoved by police 'horrified' by Trump's tweet
item.description: President Trump suggested in a baseless tweet that 75-year-old Martin Gugino, who was seriously injured after being shoved by police officers in Buffalo, New York, may have been part of a "set up." His friend Keith Giles says anyone who knows Gugino would find that theory to be "extremely hilarious."

item.title: China removes pangolin scales from traditional medicine list, helping protect world's most trafficked mammal
item.description: The Chinese government has removed pangolin scales from its 2020 list of approved ingredients used in traditional Chinese medicine, a move campaigners describe as a "critical step" towards saving the world's most trafficked mammal.

item.title: The story behind Trump's conspiracy theory tweet
item.description: In an unsubstantiated claim, President Donald Trump tweeted, without evidence, that a 75-year-old man who was seriously injured after being shoved by police officers in Buffalo, New York, may have been part of a "set up." CNN's Brian Stelter explains how Trump came to retweet that claim.

item.title: Footballer rescued after being stranded at Mumbai airport for 74 days
item.description: A Ghanaian footballer who slept in an Indian airport for over two months during the country's coronavirus lockdown has finally left the hub.

item.title: Pence deletes tweet showing Trump campaign staff not wearing face masks or social distancing
Hospitalizations climb in various US states following Memorial Day
13,500-year-old bird figurine could be prehistoric art's 'missing link'
item.description: A Stone Age bird sculpture uncovered in China may reshape our understanding of prehistoric art in Asia, according to researchers.

item.title: North Korea might be making millions -- and breaking sanctions -- selling sand. Yes, sand.
item.description: It was May of last year when Lucas Kuo and Lauren Sung noticed something strange: more than 100 ships gathering in the waters near Haeju, North Korea.

item.title: How the search for missing Idaho children went from parents in Hawaii to the discovery of human remains
item.description: When police discovered human remains on Chad Daybell's property, they may have taken a step closer to answering a question that family, friends and many others have been asking for months: where are Tylee Ryan and Joshua "JJ" Vallow?

item.title: US intercepts Russian bombers and fighter jets off coast of Alaska in international airspace
item.description: The United States intercepted Russian bombers and fighter jets off the coast of Alaska on Wednesday morning, according to North American Aerospace Defense Command.

item.title: 'Giant warning siren' sounds for US election after Georgia's disastrous primary
item.description: A perfect storm of Election Day problems made parts of Georgia the new poster child for the perils states face as they adapt American voting procedures to meet the needs of voters during a pandemic.

item.title: Banksy artwork stolen from Paris' Bataclan theater is found in Italy
item.description: Italian police have found a Banksy artwork that was stolen from outside the Bataclan theater in Paris last year.

item.title: J.K. Rowling explains her gender identity views in essay amid backlash
item.description: Author J.K Rowling is once again trying to explain her views on gender identity amid backlash over statements she made on social media that have drawn criticism from some who brought many of her written works to the big screen, including Daniel Radcliffe and Eddie Redmayne.

item.title: Fed says it will keep stimulus coming for years
item.description: The Federal Reserve left interest rates unchanged Wednesday and committed to maintaining its unprecedented stimulus plan until the economy "has weathered recent events."

item.title: Lawyer: DOJ dropping Flynn case is 'a gross abuse of prosecutorial power'
item.description: Former national security adviser Michael Flynn should be sentenced for lying, including perjuring himself in court, rather than have the charges against him dismissed, a court-appointed attorney and former judge said Wednesday.

item.title: CNN anchor: This makes us squirm, but it's killing us
item.description: CNN's Don Lemon says Rev. Al Sharpton's eulogy confronted reality that racism killed George Floyd and that truth will make a lot of Americans uncomfortable.

item.title: CrossFit CEO told gym owners he doesn't mourn George Floyd
item.description: Hours before tweeting controversial statements about George Floyd on Saturday, former CrossFit CEO Greg Glassman made insensitive comments about race on a video call with affiliate gym owners.

item.title: Fellow Africans, it is time for us to check our own race privilege
item.description: "Why didn't you tell me, mummy? I'm so upset!"

item.title: L'Oreal dropped this model for commenting on racism. Now it wants her back.
item.description: L'Oreal has asked model Munroe Bergdorf to advise the company on diversity and inclusion, three years after it dropped her for comments about systemic racism.

item.title: UK rapper shares video of his father being Tasered by police
item.description: British rapper Wretch 32 says there has been "no progression" in the fight against police brutality in the UK, after sharing a video of his father being Tasered by officers at his home in north London.

item.title: 81-year-old movie pulled from HBO Max until it can return with 'historical context'
item.description: HBO Max has pulled "Gone with the Wind" from its library of films.

item.title: Kremlin spokesperson speaks out on Russia's handling of virus
item.description: In an exclusive interview with CNN, Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov, who tested positive for Covid-19 in May, said "nothing went wrong" in Russia's attempts to contain the virus.

item.title: The 'Covid-free' Italian town selling $1 houses
item.description: The global pandemic has put a halt to many travel experiences, including the rush to snap up Italian homes at bargain prices, but now that some places are emerging from restrictions, the country's one-dollar home bonanza seems to be back on.

item.title: Disney fans say Splash Mountain should be re-themed
item.description: One of Disney's best-loved rides is based on a film widely considered the studio's most racist.

item.title: Drone footage captures thousands of turtles nesting
item.description: Researchers have captured beautiful aerial footage of thousands of green turtles on the edge of Australia's Great Barrier Reef during the nesting season.

item.title: Archaeologists think they've found London's oldest theater
item.description: A team of archaeologists may have discovered the oldest purpose-built theater in London beneath a construction site in Whitechapel.

item.title: Tyson Fury confirms two-fight deal to face Anthony Joshua
item.description: British world heavyweight champions Tyson Fury and Anthony Joshua are set to fight in 2021.

item.title: The illegal industry booming under lockdown in South Africa
item.description: In South Africa, a coronavirus ban on cigarettes and alcohol has sparked an illegal business. CNN's David McKenzie speaks with soldiers trying to enforce the ban and with a Zimbabwean cigarette smuggler, who says his "profits are up."

item.title: NASCAR bans Confederate flags
item.description: Ahead of its Cup Series race Wednesday night in Martinsville, Virginia, NASCAR said it is banning the flying of Confederate flags at its races and other events.

item.title: Architects have designed a Martian city for the desert
item.description: Dubai is a city where firefighters use jetpacks, archipelagos are built from scratch, and buildings climb into the clouds; a slick metropolis in the middle of a vast red desert. First-time visitors would be forgiven for thinking they had stumbled onto a film set for a sci-fi movie.

item.title: Former astronaut becomes first woman to visit lowest point on Earth
item.description: Just eight people have reached Challenger Deep, the deepest point of the ocean. More than 550 people have visited space.

item.title: Why Anna Kendrick compares filming 'Twilight' to surviving a 'hostage situation'
item.description: "Twilight" devotees loved the movie but filming it was not much fun, according to Anna Kendrick.

item.title: Photographer's radiant love letter to the New York City subway
item.description: The subway system in New York City snakes through each of its five boroughs, connecting residents via hundreds of miles of electrified tracks. Just as passengers have been accustomed to the idiosyncrasies of the Metropolitan Transit Authority (MTA) -- including its frequent delays and signal malfunctions -- so too have they become familiar with art and performing arts within the trains and stations. In the 1980s, in particular, as street art exploded around the city, the steel train cars became the canvases for graffiti artists.

item.title: Summer is here, and your mask is sweaty. Here's what to do about it
item.description: It's hot. You're sweaty. And if you're still coronavirus-conscious, then you're wearing your mask.

item.title: 'Oh you must be heavy boned.' Marilyn Okoro's fight for body acceptance
item.description: She was comfortable with her body, though others were not.

item.title: My journey with body image in athletics
item.description: Marilyn Okoro is an Olympic bronze medal-winning sprinter, but she's had a life filled with people criticizing her body. How did this happen throughout her career?

item.title: 'Choose Your Own Fake News' game wants to tackle misinformation
item.description: Africa like many other parts of the world has witnessed a recent rise in the spread of misinformation.

item.title: Black people are largely ignored by the travel industry, but that hasn't kept us home
item.description: As part of the Black Lives Matter movement, protesters recently looped a rope around the Confederate Soldiers and Sailors Monument in Birmingham, Alabama, and tried to drag it to the ground. The statue had long irked many locals, but a state law prohibits the removal of any Confederate monuments like this one.

item.title: Will people still flock to theaters in wake of pandemic?
item.description: Sony Motion Pictures Chairman Tom Rothman told CNN's Chloe Melas that he thinks people will be more excited to get out of their house to go to the movie theater after the coronavirus pandemic forced some theaters to close.

item.title: US President said the bases, which bear the names of Confederate commanders, are part of a "great American heritage"
Republicans watch Trump's eroding standing with unease
item.description: • Trump campaign demands CNN apologize for poll that shows Biden leading • LIVE: Black Lives Matter protests continue across the US

item.title: Police chief orders officers to keep body cameras on during protests
The remarkable collapse of Trump's polling numbers
item.description: One of the defining traits of President Donald Trump's time in office has been the consistency of his poll numbers.

item.title: CNN host: For Trump, continued chaos is the plan
item.description: Reflecting on the events that have so far defined 2020, CNN's SE Cupp says President Trump has "collapsed spectacularly" under the weight of what is required from him as commander in chief.
